intro: Pimpinella adiyamanensis, commonly known as Adiyaman cowparsley, is a rare endemic species native to Turkey. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, white flowers are accompanied by finely divided leaves, typical of the genus Pimpinella. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
